thread.section_title: Business and technology news from SF Bay Area and the world - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: When it comes to our data, who’s minding the store?
thread.title_full: When it comes to our data, who’s minding the store? - San Francisco Chronicle

author: David Einstein
title: When it comes to our data, who’s minding the store?
text:
Photo: Richard Drew, Associated Press People pass a T-Mobile store, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. The top Democrat on the Senate Banking Committee is calling for the credit agency Experian to disclose more details about a data breach in which personal information on millions of T-Mobile customers was stolen. (AP Photo/Richard Drew) People pass a T-Mobile store, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 14,...
Commerce depends on trust, but right now, it’s hard to know who to trust when you go online. In recent months, the news has been peppered with tales of data breaches, alleged skulduggery and deceit — in some cases involving companies that deal in data security. People pass a T-Mobile store, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. The top Democrat on the Senate Banking Committee is calling for the credit agency Experian to disclose more details about a data breach in which personal information on millions of T-Mobile customers was stolen. (AP Photo/Richard Drew) People pass a T-Mobile store, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 14,...
Commerce depends on trust, but right now, it’s hard to know who to trust when you go online. In recent months, the news has been peppered with tales of data breaches, alleged skulduggery and deceit — in some cases involving companies that deal in data security.
